perturbation.original_text: The Steering Committee shall appoint, within 30 days of the signature of this JV, a Technical Committee composed of one representative of each of the Parties in relation to each specific -3- clinical trial program, which shall have the function of coordinating the technical and administrative activities to be undertaken in the framework of this JV.
perturbation.changed_text: The Steering Committee shall appoint, within 90 days of the signature of this JV, a Technical Committee composed of one representative of each of the Parties in relation to each specific -3- clinical trial program, which shall have the function of coordinating the technical and administrative activities to be undertaken in the framework of this JV.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the deadline for appointing the Technical Committee to 90 days could contradict standard business practice requiring timely project commencement, especially in research settings where momentum is key. This delay can obstruct the project's prompt progress, potentially conflicting with regulations emphasizing prompt commencement of research activities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract Principles; Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing

perturbation.original_text: The Parties undertake to promptly notify each other about the achievement of the Scope, as mentioned in point 2 ("the Results") , that may be subject to Industrial and Intellectual Property Rights, within 30 days from the achievement of such Results and to cooperate in the evaluation of the existence of the necessary requirements for the patenting/registration of such Results.
perturbation.changed_text: The Parties undertake to notify each other about the achievement of the Scope, as mentioned in point 2 ("the Results"), that may be subject to Industrial and Intellectual Property Rights, within 90 days from the achievement of such Results and to cooperate in the evaluation of the existence of the necessary requirements for the patenting/registration of such Results.
perturbation.explanation: Extending the notification period for intellectual property rights achievement to 90 days creates non-compliance with best practices for IP protection. Quick notification is vital for securing IP rights; a 90-day delay could lead to losing priority in patent applications, violating the duty to protect and maximize the joint venture's IP assets.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Patent Law (First-to-File Systems); Duty of Care in IP Management

perturbation.original_text: The consent of Kiromic will be tacitly granted after 30 days from receipt of the request for authorization of disclosure.
perturbation.changed_text: The consent of Kiromic will be tacitly granted after 5 days from receipt of the request for authorization of disclosure.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the consent period for publication approval to 5 days places unreasonable constraints on the reviewing party. It potentially infringes on their ability to conduct thorough due diligence, ensure accuracy, and safeguard proprietary information. This abbreviated timeline introduces compliance issues with contractual fairness.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Reasonable Notice Requirements; Duty to Act in Good Faith
